meanings.definition: To seize or grab onto something eagerly or greedily.
meanings.sent1: The child was glomming onto the candy jar, hoping for a treat.
meanings.sent2: The raccoon was glomming onto the trash can, searching for food.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was glomming onto the toy, wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The salesperson was glomming onto every potential customer, trying to make a sale.
meanings.sent5: The student was glomming onto every word the teacher said, eager to learn.

meanings.sent2: The kitten was glomming onto the yarn, playing happily.

meanings.sent5: The toddler was glomming onto the colorful balloon, laughing with joy.
